channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Fast Segment Anything
item.description: In this paper, we propose a speed-up alternative method for this fundamental task with comparable performance.

item.title: Faster Segment Anything: Towards Lightweight SAM for Mobile Applications
item.description: Concretely, we distill the knowledge from the image encoder ViT-H in the original SAM to a lightweight image encoder, which can be automatically compatible with the mask decoder in the original SAM.

item.title: Drag Your GAN: Interactive Point-based Manipulation on the Generative Image Manifold
item.description: Synthesizing visual content that meets users' needs often requires flexible and precise controllability of the pose, shape, expression, and layout of the generated objects.

item.title: LightGlue: Local Feature Matching at Light Speed
item.description: We introduce LightGlue, a deep neural network that learns to match local features across images.

item.title: PanoHead: Geometry-Aware 3D Full-Head Synthesis in 360$^{\circ}$
item.description: We propose PanoHead, the first 3D-aware generative model that enables high-quality view-consistent image synthesis of full heads in $360^\circ$ with diverse appearance and detailed geometry using only in-the-wild unstructured images for training.

item.title: Planning-oriented Autonomous Driving
item.description: Oriented at this, we revisit the key components within perception and prediction, and prioritize the tasks such that all these tasks contribute to planning.

item.title: MotionGPT: Human Motion as a Foreign Language
item.description: Building upon this "motion vocabulary", we perform language modeling on both motion and text in a unified manner, treating human motion as a specific language.

item.title: A Survey on Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Multimodal Large Language Model (MLLM) recently has been a new rising research hotspot, which uses powerful Large Language Models (LLMs) as a brain to perform multimodal tasks.

item.title: WebGLM: Towards An Efficient Web-Enhanced Question Answering System with Human Preferences
item.description: We present WebGLM, a web-enhanced question-answering system based on the General Language Model (GLM).

item.title: A Novel Correlation-optimized Deep Learning Method for Wind Speed Forecast
item.description: Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed method is verified by three wind prediction cases from a wind farm in Liaoning, China.

item.title: FinGPT: Open-Source Financial Large Language Models
item.description: While proprietary models like BloombergGPT have taken advantage of their unique data accumulation, such privileged access calls for an open-source alternative to democratize Internet-scale financial data.

item.title: WizardCoder: Empowering Code Large Language Models with Evol-Instruct
item.description: Moreover, our model even outperforms the largest closed LLMs, Anthropic's Claude and Google's Bard, on HumanEval and HumanEval+.

item.title: Bring Your Own Data! Self-Supervised Evaluation for Large Language Models
item.description: With the rise of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their ubiquitous deployment in diverse domains, measuring language model behavior on realistic data is imperative.

item.title: PyRCA: A Library for Metric-based Root Cause Analysis
item.description: We introduce PyRCA, an open-source Python machine learning library of Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for Artificial Intelligence for IT Operations (AIOps).

item.title: ToolQA: A Dataset for LLM Question Answering with External Tools
item.description: To address this issue, we introduce a new dataset called ToolQA, which is designed to faithfully evaluate LLMs' ability to use external tools for question answering.

item.title: FlashAttention: Fast and Memory-Efficient Exact Attention with IO-Awareness
item.description: We also extend FlashAttention to block-sparse attention, yielding an approximate attention algorithm that is faster than any existing approximate attention method.

item.title: Enlighten Anything: When Segment Anything Model Meets Low-Light Image Enhancement
item.description: Image restoration is a low-level visual task, and most CNN methods are designed as black boxes, lacking transparency and intrinsic aesthetics.

item.title: Data-Copilot: Bridging Billions of Data and Humans with Autonomous Workflow
item.description: Various industries such as finance, meteorology, and energy generate vast amounts of heterogeneous data every day.

item.title: Direct Preference Optimization: Your Language Model is Secretly a Reward Model
item.description: However, RLHF is a complex and often unstable procedure, first fitting a reward model that reflects the human preferences, and then fine-tuning the large unsupervised LM using reinforcement learning to maximize this estimated reward without drifting too far from the original model.

item.title: Restart Sampling for Improving Generative Processes
item.description: Restart not only outperforms the previous best SDE results, but also accelerates the sampling speed by 10-fold / 2-fold on CIFAR-10 / ImageNet $64 \times 64$.
